Detailed Description

powerup.cpp

Creates an instance of a powerup, and when called upon the advance method, it travels down the Y-axis checking for collisions with the player ship.

Author: Natraj Subramanian

Definition at line 21 of file powerup.h.

void Powerup::advance ( int  phase  ) 

Definition at line 54 of file powerup.cpp.

00055 {
00056     if(!phase) return;
00057 
00058     if(yPos < 95)
00059     {
00060         QList<QGraphicsItem *> hits = this->collidingItems(Qt::IntersectsItemBoundingRect);
00061 
00062         if(!hits.isEmpty())
00063         {
00064             // Checks if the first item that collidingItems has detected
00065             // has the ID_SPACESHIP as its type and not BLOCKID
00066             // If it does then the powerup icon is set invisible and then
00067             // subsequently removed from the scene.
00068             if(hits.first()->type() == ID_SPACESHIP && hits.first()->type() != BLOCKID)
00069             {
00070                 powerupAcquired = new QSound("tone2.wav");
00071                 powerupAcquired->setLoops(1);
00072                 powerupAcquired->play();
00073                 this->setVisible(false);
00074                 this->scene()->removeItem(this);
00075 
00076                 // Powerup type 1 specifies a slow down of the ball
00077                 // If powerup type is 1, then set the static variable
00078                 // powerup in the constants class to 1, so that it
00079                 // can be read in by the ball during its next clock
00080                 // cycle.
00081                 // Powerup type 2 specifies a speed up of the ball
00082                 if(this->powerupType == 1)
00083                 {
00084                     if(Constants::powerup != 1)
00085                     {
00086                         Constants::powerup = 1;
00087                     }
00088                 }
00089                 if(this->powerupType == 2)
00090                 {
00091                     if(Constants::powerup != 2)
00092                     {
00093                         Constants::powerup = 2;
00094                     }
00095                 }
00096             }
00097         }
00098 
00099         // Move the ball down the Y Axis by directionY
00100         yPos-=directionY;
00101         setPos(xPos, yPos);
00102     }
00103     else
00104     {
00105         // If the powerup has passed the boundary of the window,
00106         // then remove it from the scene.
00107         Constants::powerup = 0;
00108         this->scene()->removeItem(this);
00109     }
00110 }
